snippet.title: Love Island's Amber Gill, Anna Vakili and Yewande Biala are 'not sure' if they will watch new winter
snippet.description: They rose to fame on the summer series of Love Island. But winner Amber Gill and her BFF's Anna Vakili and Yewande Biala admitted they're not sure if they will watch the brand new winter series of the hit ITV2 show. It comes after Caroline Flack, 40, stepped down as host after being charged with assaulting her toyboy boyfriend Lewis Burton, 27, at her London home earlier this month.     When asked by Ben Shepherd: 'Will you watch winter series?', the host was met with deadly silence.  Amber was the first to answer: 'I will be, yeah, I am going to try,' while Anna, 29, rather unconvincingly said: 'I am going to try, see it from a different perspective. Now you’ve been in it, it’s different, you see it all.' During their appearance, the girls also spoke about the advice they would give to any islanders.    Amber said: 'What I would do differently if I could turn back time, don’t take everything to heart or too seriously. 'Take it more lighthearted and fun. I kept it real, I am not sure if that is a good or bad thing.'Yewande added: 'Just enjoy it, everyone said to me, enjoy it, I didn’t understand. When you come out, you realise I’ve had the most amazing experience not everyone gets to have. Enjoy each day, be happy and just enjoy.'   Amber, who shortly split from Greg O'Shea after winning the show, concluded: 'Just keep it real, always be yourself. Stay true to yourself, don’t be hung up on winning, just stick to what feels right.' The trio's appearance comes after Caroline pleaded not guilty to assaulting her boyfriend, 27, at Highbury Magistrates' Court on Monday. Caroline and her partner were both allegedly covered in blood when police arrived at their flat in Islington, North London, on December 12 - with one officer describing the chaotic scene as 'like a horror movie'.   On Monday she pleaded not guilty to common assault and was released on bail until her trial in March but is not allowed to contact Lewis. The presenter was accused of 'going mad' and smashing a glass after looking at texts which made her think Lewis was cheating - with him saying in a 999 call that she 'tried to kill me, mate', Highbury Corner Magistrates' Court heard.Lewis was said to have been 'almost begging the operator to send help' with his face 'covered in blood', while Caroline - who has now been replaced as Love Island host by Laura Whitmore - allegedly had two cuts to her wrist.  After being taken into custody, ITV host Caroline - whom the court heard was 'manipulative' towards Lewis and accused him of ruining her life - allegedly flipped over a table and had to be restrained on the ground by police.  In the wake of the drama, Caroline stepped down from her hosting duties and Laura Whitmore was announced as her replacement.
